content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Pick the best new idea and actually WRITE the code to implement it as a new PopeBot skill in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). Write and execute a test to prove it works. Use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a progress report detailing what you built, how you implemented it, your test results, and code samples so the user can review it at 8 AM.

content.thinking:
The user wants me to:
1. Scan three GitHub repos for new tools, skills, and architectures
2. Pick the best new idea
3. Implement it as a new PopeBot skill in .pi/skills/
4. Write and execute a test to prove it works
5. Email a progress report to winsorllc@yahoo.com

Let me start by exploring these repositories. I'll need to use git to clone them or use the browser-tools skill to explore them. Let me first check what's available and then systematically explore each repo.

Let me start by using bash to git clone these repos temporarily to explore them.

content.text: I'll systematically scan these three repositories to discover new tools, skills, and architectures. Let me start by cloning them to explore their contents.

arguments.command: mkdir -p /job/tmp/repos && cd /job/tmp/repos && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw.git zeroclaw 2>&1 | head -20

content.thinking: Good, starting the clone. Let me continue cloning the other repos.

arguments.command: cd /job/tmp/repos && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw.git openclaw 2>&1 | head -20

content.thinking: Good, now let me clone thepopebot as well to compare.

content.text: Now let me explore the structure of each repository to understand what tools, skills, and architectures they contain.
